resources.string: Cambridge Dictionary Dictionary Translate Grammar Log in English (UK) Follow us Log in English (UK) Menu Dictionary Translate Grammar Back to home page Search Term GrammarEnglish–FrenchFrench–English Meaning of “scroll” in the English Dictionary English American Business scroll in English See all translations scrollnoun [ C ] uk ​ /skrəʊl/ us ​ /skroʊl/ ​ a long roll of paper or similar material with usually official writing on it: The ancient Egyptians stored information on scrolls. ​ a decoration that looks like a roll of paper: The tops of the marble pillars were decorated with scrolls. Thesaurus: synonyms and related words Decorating or making something attractive accessorize adorn adornment beautify bedeck edged embellish festoon flock garland glam ornament ornamentation ornate pimp prettify titivate twiddly window dressing zhuzh See more results » scrollverb [ I usually + adv/prep ] uk ​ /skrəʊl/ us ​ /skroʊl/ ​ C2 to move text or other information on a computer screen in order to see a different part of it: Scroll to the end of the document.
